item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 1, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. How to gain code execution on hundreds of millions of people and popular apps (871 points | 210 comments)
2. Self-Hosting a Firefox Sync Server (300 points | 68 comments)
3. The vinyl-carver sparking a craze for cutting records at home (53 points | 23 comments)
4. A DOGE staffer appears to be posting DOGE work on his public GitHub (176 points | 108 comments)
5. Yes, Claude Code can decompile itself. Here's the source code (109 points | 53 comments)
6. OpenGL to WASM, learning from my mistakes (6 points | 1 comment)
7. Certificate Transparency in Firefox: A Big Step for Web Security (83 points | 58 comments)
8. Depending in Common Lisp – Using the CLOS dependent maintenance protocol (2022) (23 points | discuss)
9. Cuts to US national parks and forests met with backlash (51 points | 20 comments)
10. Zen 5's AVX-512 Frequency Behavior (118 points | 36 comments)
11. Inheriting is becoming nearly as important as working (281 points | 373 comments)
12. What do people see when they're tripping? Analyzing Erowid's trip reports (67 points | 89 comments)
13. 3,200% CPU Utilization (413 points | 189 comments)
14. The Housing Theory of Everything (2021) (154 points | 129 comments)
15. Why it's so hard to build a jet engine (233 points | 86 comments)
16. OlmOCR: Open-source tool to extract plain text from PDFs (244 points | 28 comments)
17. Harnessing orbital Hall effect in spin-orbit torque MRAM (32 points | discuss)
18. Troubleshooting: A skill that never goes obsolete (272 points | 86 comments)
19. Type++: Prohibiting Type Confusion with Inline Type Information [pdf] (5 points | discuss)
20. Affixes: The Building Blocks of English (77 points | 12 comments)
21. When eBPF pt_regs reads return garbage on the latest Linux kernels, blame Fred (88 points | 8 comments)
22. Show HN: Torii – a framework agnostic authentication library for Rust (64 points | 14 comments)
23. Write to Escape Your Default Setting (339 points | 82 comments)
24. AI is killing some companies, yet others are thriving – let's look at the data (212 points | 210 comments)
25. Boris Spassky: 1937–2025 (292 points | 58 comments)
26. An update on Mozilla's terms of use for Firefox (448 points | 263 comments)
27. Vibe Coding and the Future of Software Engineering (100 points | 76 comments)
28. Calendar.txt (324 points | 127 comments)
29. Resident physicians' exam scores tied to patient survival (66 points | 58 comments)
30. Merlion: A Machine Learning Framework for Time Series Intelligence (147 points | 21 comments)
